techmeme.title: Sources: Indonesia and Apple have agreed to lift the iPhone 16 ban, with Apple set to invest $1B; a memorandum of agreement may be signed this week (Faris Mokhtar/Bloomberg)
Sources: left-leaning staff at Meta, Apple, Google, and Amazon mostly stayed silent on their CEOs attending Trump's inauguration due to a less secure job market (Financial Times)
Tesla starts rolling out a software update enabling driver-assistance features, similar to Full Self-Driving in the US, for Chinese customers who paid $8,800 (Bloomberg)
Over 1,000 musicians, including Kate Bush, "co-write" a "silent" album to protest a UK proposal letting AI train on their copyrighted work if they don't opt out (Dan Milmo/The Guardian)
Epic v. Apple: Phil Schiller says he initially feared Apple's 27% App Store fee posed a compliance risk and could create "antagonistic" developer relations (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
